clinical_history: Thyroid swelling and suspected nodular disease.
technique: High-resolution linear and curvilinear probes used for detailed evaluation.
findings: Urinary bladder is isoechoic, no intraluminal lesions.
Gallbladder shows coarse, no stones or wall thickening.
Testes are enlarged with normal vascularity.
Breast tissue shows hypoechoic lesion measuring 21.98 mm.
Common bile duct measures 26.3 mm, within normal limits.
